newsitem.title: JAPAN: NCB to brief media on restructuring, earnings.
newsitem.headline: NCB to brief media on restructuring, earnings.

text.p: Nippon Credit Bank Ltd said on Tuesday that it would hold a news conference at 4.15 p.m. (0715 GMT) on its restructuring plans and revisions to its earnings forecasts.

Last week, Nippon Credit Bank said it expected to unveil a restructuring plan in early April. The bank did not provide details of the plan but banking sources have said it will include sales of real estate and the closure of some operations overseas.
Japanese media reports have said the plan will also include the disposal of problem loans held by the bank's troubled nonbank financial affiliates.
The bank said earlier on Tuesday that three non-bank financial affiliates had filed for bankruptcy at Tokyo District Court, but did not give details such as the scale of their debt.
Private credit research firm Teikoku Data Bank said the affiliates have total debts of 2.025 trillion yen.
